tn.text: This is another name for Gideon. See how you translated his name in [[:en:bible:notes:jdg:06:31|6:32]].
"they set up their camp"

tn.ref: spring of Harod ... hill of Moreh
tn.text: These are the names of places. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: The camp of Midian was to their north
tn.text: Here "Midian" represents the Midianite army. AT: "The Midianite army set up their camp to the north of the Israelite army" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: for me to give you victory over the Midianites
tn.text: The word "victory" is an abstract noun. AT: "for me to allow you to defeat the Midianites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: Our own power has saved us
tn.text: Here "power" represents the people themselves. AT: "We have saved ourselves without God's help" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This does not mean "at this moment," but is used to draw attention to the important point that follows.

tn.ref: proclaim in the ears of the people
tn.text: Here "the ears" refers to the whole person. AT: "proclaim to the people" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])
Both of these phrases have the same meaning. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])
This word describes fear that causes a person to uncontrollably shake. AT: "shakes with fear"
You can make explicit where he will go. AT: "let him return to his home" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
This is the name of a mountain in the region of Gilead. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
two thousand** - "22,000" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
The word "people" or "men" is understood. AT: "10,000 people remained" or "10,000 men remained" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
"10,000" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: and I will make their number smaller for you there
tn.text: Here "number" represents the army. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "and there, I will show you who to send home so the army will have less men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "brought" can be translated as "took" or "led." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_go]])
to drink by licking with the tongue
"300 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
"300 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: I will rescue you and give you victory
tn.text: Here "you" is plural and refers to Gideon and the Israelites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_you]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "So those whom Yahweh chose" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: took their supplies and their trumpets
tn.text: Here "their" refers to the Israelite soldiers who were leaving the army.
This word is used here to mark a break in the storyline. Here the narrator starts to tell a new part of the story.

tn.ref: Attack the camp, for I am going to give you victory over it
tn.text: Here "camp" refers to the whole Midianite army. AT: "Attack the Midianites at their camp, for I am going to help you defeat them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])
You can make clear the understood information. AT: "afraid to go down to attack" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: and your courage will be strengthened
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "and what you hear will be encourage you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
places around the edge of an area where soldiers stand to watch for an enemy army

tn.ref: as thick as a cloud of locusts
tn.text: Here "cloud" means a swarm. The author speaks of the army as if it were a swarm of locusts to emphasize how many soldiers there were. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: Their camels were more ... in number than the grains of the sand on the seashore
tn.text: The author uses a hyperbole, an exaggeration, to emphasize that there were very many camels. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_hyperbole]])

tn.ref: Their camels were more than could be counted
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Their camels were more than anyone could count" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: This is nothing other than the sword of Gideon
tn.text: Here "the sword of Gideon" refers to Gideon's army attacking.  AT: "The loaf of barley bread in your dream must be the army of Gideon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: God has given him victory over Midian
tn.text: This future event is spoken of as if it were a past event. This emphasizes that it will certainly happen. AT: "God will certainly help the Israelites defeat the Midianites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_pastforfuture]])
"300 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
The words "we fight" are implied. AT: "We fight for Yahweh and for Gideon!" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
"100 men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: right at the beginning of the middle watch
tn.text: The beginning of the middle watch would be around 10 o'clock at night.

tn.ref: The sword of Yahweh and of Gideon
tn.text: Here "sword" refers to their fighting. AT: "We fight for Yahweh and for Gideon" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"300 trumpets" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Yahweh set every Midianite man's sword against his comrades
tn.text: Here "sword" refers to their attack with the use of the sword. AT: "Yahweh caused every Midianite man to fight against his fellow soldiers" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: Beth Shittah ... Zererah ... Abel Meholah ... Tabbath
tn.text: These are the names of towns and cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: The men of Israel from Naphtali, Asher, and all Manasseh were called out
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Gideon called out the Israelites from the tribes of Naphtali, Asher, and all Mannasseh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the name of a town. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: and took control of the waters, as far as Beth Barah and the Jordan River
tn.text: "and took control of the area of the Jordan River as far south as Beth Barah"

tn.ref: at the rock of Oreb ... at the winepress of Zeeb
tn.text: The places were given these names after the Israelites killed Oreb and Zeeb there. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
